availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton Frazer (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, physician and soldier.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to George Ann Miller Frazer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, on July 12, 1849. Father of James M. Frazer, Eliza C. Frazer, Louis M. Frazer, and John M. Frazer. Physician in Andrew County, Missouri, in 1850. Resident of Oregon Territory in 1855. Physician in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from October 8, 1861, to February 27, 1862. Resigned on account of disease on February 27, 1862. Died of disease in Rockcastle County on May 31, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, Andrew County, Rochester Township, p. 118A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 583.
Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Widows and Other Dependents of Civil War Veterans, ca. 1861 – ca. 1910, NARA RG 15, Application WC14817.
Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Widows and Other Dependents of Civil War Veterans, ca. 1861 – ca. 1910, NARA RG 15, Application 120709.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0172.
